body.p: The Filters tab allows you to add filters to remove certain content elements from the generated output.

You can choose one of the following options to define filters:
Use DITAVAL file If you already have a DITAVAL file associated with the DITA map, you can specify the file to be used when filtering content. You can find out more about constructing a DITAVAL file in the DITA Documentation.If a filter file is specified in the args.filter parameter (in the Parameters tab), the filters are combined (neither file takes precedence over the other).
Use profiling condition set Sets the profiling condition set that will be applied to your transformation.
Exclude from output all elements with any of the following attributes By using the New, Edit, or Delete buttons at the bottom of the pane, you can configure a list of attributes (name and value) to exclude all elements that contain any of these attributes from the output.
The colors and styles of the profiled content settings are used for rendering it in Author mode but are not applied in the output.
